title: Agent Systems for Coalition Search and Rescue Task Support

references.title: A Coalition Force Scenario 'Binni - Gateway to the Golden Bowl of Africa',
references.raw: Rathmell, R.A. (1999) A Coalition Force Scenario 'Binni - Gateway to the Golden Bowl of Africa', in Proceedings of the International Workshop on Knowledge-Based Planning for Coalition Forces, (ed. Tate, A.) pp. 115-125, Edinburgh, Scotland, 10-11 May 1999.

references.title: Applying KAoS services to ensure policy compliance for semantic web services workflow composition and enactment.
references.raw: Uszok, A., Bradshaw, J. M., Jeffers, R., Tate, A. & Dalton, J. (2004). Applying KAoS services to ensure policy compliance for semantic web services workflow composition and enactment. in Proceedings of the 3 rd International Semantic Web Conference (ISWC 2004), Hiroshima, Japan, November 7-11.

references.title: Coalition Task Support using I-X and
references.raw: Tate, A. (2003). Coalition Task Support using I-X and <I-N-C-A>. Proceedings of the Third International Central and Eastern European Conference on Multi-Agent Systems (CEEMAS 2003), 16-18 June, Prague, Czech Republic, LNAI 2691. (pp. 7-16). Berlin: Springer.

references.title: I-P 2 - Intelligent Process Panels to Support Coalition Operations,
references.raw: Tate, A., Dalton, J., and Stader, J. (2002) I-P 2 - Intelligent Process Panels to Support Coalition Operations, Proceedings of the Second International Conference on Knowledge Systems for Coalition Operations (KSCO-2002), Toulouse, France, 23-24 April 2002.

references.title: I-P2 - Intelligent Process Panels to Support Coalition Operations,
Intelligent Agents for Coalition Search and Rescue Task Support,
references.raw: 1 http://www.wsmo.org/ Tate, A., Dalton, J., Siebra, C., Aitken, S., Bradshaw, J.M. and Uszok, A.  (2004) Intelligent Agents for Coalition Search and Rescue Task Support,  AAAI-2004 Intelligent Systems Demonstrator, in Proceedings of the 9 th National Conference of the American Association of Artificial  Intelligence, (AAAI-2004), San Jose, California, USA, July 2004.

references.title: Representation and reasoning for DAML-based policy and domain services in KAoS and Nomads.
references.raw: Bradshaw, J. M., Uszok, A., Jeffers, R., Suri, N., Hayes, P., Burstein, M. H., Acquisti, A., Benyo, B., Breedy, M. R., Carvalho, M., Diller, D., Johnson, M., Kulkarni, S., Lott, J., Sierhuis, M., & Van Hoof, R. (2003). Representation and reasoning for DAML-based policy and domain services in KAoS and Nomads. Proceedings of the Autonomous Agents and Multi-Agent Systems Conference (AAMAS 2003). Melbourne, Australia, New York, NY: ACM Press.

references.title: The Coalition Agents Experiment:
references.raw: Allsopp, D., Beautement, P., Kirton, M., Tate, A., Bradshaw, J.M., Suri, N. and Burstein, M. (2003) The Coalition Agents Experiment: Network-Enabled Coalition Operations, Special Issue on Network-enabled Capabilities, Journal of Defence Science, Vol. 8, No. 3, pp. 130-141, September 2003.

The views and conclusions contained herein are the author’s and shouldn’t be interpreted as necessarily representing the official policies or endorsements, either expressed or implied, of other parties.The Coalition Search and Rescue Task Support project shows cooperative agents supporting a highly dynamic mission in which AI task planning, inter-agent collaboration, workflow enactment, policy-managed services, semantic web queries, semantic web services matchmaking and knowledge-based notifications are employed

The Coalition Search and Rescue Task Support project shows cooperative agents supporting a highly dynamic mission in which AI task planning, inter-agent collaboration, workflow enactment, policy-managed services, semantic web queries, semantic web services matchmaking and knowledge-based notifications are employed.</dc:description><dc:date>
